body:
In my experience, I'm just about as likely to want to use temporary shadow effects like Shadow Rift and Dauthi Embrace as a "target creature can't block this turn" effect on one of my opponent's creatures as I am to use them as a "target creature is unblockable this turn" effect on my own. It'd be nice if I didn't have to go into preferences every time I wanted to do this.

I feel like most of the other times I need to hit that setting, it's because of some specific weird two-card interaction, whereas this is just the rules of shadow plus basic combat logic...
author: [manve.he...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/107839499302741838633/)
title: Granting temporary shadow to opponent's creatures shouldn't count as an "unusual target choice"
